class  Partition

Detailed Description

User-extendable MIME type registry.

Class MimeTypeTable provides static methods for conversions between MIME type, file extension, and MIME type string. It also can tell whether MIME data is encoded in a binary or textual format.

User SW can register additional MIME types for use with MimeTypeTable. This can be accomplished using the macros from MimeTypeTableUtils.hpp to set up an extension table, which automatically registers with MimeTypeTable by means of a small 'hook' class.

Note:Currently only one instance of an extension table is supported (system-wide !). Attempting to set up a second one will result in an assertion.

Member Function Documentation

const CHAR * MimeTypeTable::GetExtByMimeStr (  const CHAR *  mime_str  )  [static]
 

Obtains the default file extension for a given MIME string.

Deprecated: Please use GetFirstExtByMimeStr().

const CHAR * MimeTypeTable::GetExtByMimeType (  MimeType  mime_type,
UINT8  offset = 0
)  [static]
 

Obtains the default file extension for a given MimeType Id.

Parameters:
offset The offset of the file extension for a particular mime type, which should be returned. This is useful if more than one file extension exists for a mime type.

const CHAR * MimeTypeTable::GetFirstExtByMimeStr (  const CHAR *  mime_str  )  [static]
 

Obtains the default file extension for a given MIME string.

The default extension is listed first, following entries are optional and can be accessed by calling GetNextExtension().

Parameters:
mime_str MIME string to look up in MimeTypeTable.
Returns:
Pointer to C-string containing the first file extension associated with 'mime_type' or pointer to an empty string when 'mime_type' when is unknown by APOXI.

const CHAR * MimeTypeTable::GetFirstExtByMimeType (  MimeType  mime_type  )  [static]
 

Obtains the default file extension for a given MimeType Id.

The default extension is listed first, following entries are optional and can be accessed by calling GetNextExtByMimeType().

Parameters:
mime_type MimeType Id to look up in MimeTypeTable.
Returns:
Pointer to C-string containing the first file extension associated with 'mime_type' or pointer to an empty string when 'mime_type' when is unknown by APOXI.

MimeType MimeTypeTable::GetMaxMimeTypeId (   )  [static]
 

Returns the largest MimeType registered with MimeTypeTable.

const CHAR * MimeTypeTable::GetMimeStrByExt (  const CHAR *  file_ext  )  [static]
 

Returns the MIME string associated with a file extension.

Parameters:
file_ext Pointer to a C-string containing a file extension.
Returns:
Pointer to the first associated MIME string when the file extension matches one of the file extension strings known by MimeTypeTable, pointer to an empty string otherwise.

const CHAR * MimeTypeTable::GetMimeStrByMimeType (  MimeType  mime_type  )  [static]
 

Returns the MIME string associated with a MimeType Id.

Parameters:
mime_type MimeType Id to look up in MimeTypeTable.
Returns:
Pointer to the first associated MIME string when the MimeType Id is known by MimeTypeTable, pointer to an empty string otherwise.

MimeType MimeTypeTable::GetMimeTypeByExt (  const CHAR *  file_ext  )  [static]
 

Returns the MimeType Id associated with a file extension.

Parameters:
file_ext Pointer to a C-string containing a file extension.
Returns:
Corresponding MimeType Id when the file extension matches one of the file extension strings known by MimeTypeTable, c_mime_unknown otherwise.

MimeType MimeTypeTable::GetMimeTypeByExt (  const CHAR *  file_ext,
UINT8 &  idx
)  [static]
 

Returns the MimeType Id associated with a file extension.

Parameters:
file_ext Pointer to a C-string containing a file extension.
idx The index of the file extension in the MimeTypeTableEntry of this mime type.
Returns:
Corresponding MimeType Id when the file extension matches one of the file extension strings known by MimeTypeTable, c_mime_unknown otherwise.

const CHAR * MimeTypeTable::GetNextExtension (  const CHAR *  file_ext  )  [static]
 

Obtains the next synonym from a list of file extensions.

Parameters:
file_ext File extension string which must have been obtained by calling either GetFirstExtByMimeType() or GetFirstExtByMimeStr() or GetNextExtension().
Returns:
Pointer to C-string containing the next file extension from the list or '0' when none is available.

INT MimeTypeTable::IsBinaryByExt (  const CHAR *  file_ext  )  [static]
 

Tells whether MIME data is encoded in a binary format.

Parameters:
file_ext Pointer to a C-string containing a file extension.
Returns:
'TRUE' when 'file_ext' is known by MimeTypeTable and data representation is binary, 'FALSE' otherwise.
